cerebral hypoperfusion (syncope/lipothymia) or cerebral activity dysfunction (epileptic seizure)

question.title: What is the primary cause of malaise in adults?
question.description: Cerebral hypoperfusion or dysfunction of cerebral activity is a key factor in malaise. What is the most likely underlying mechanism?

option_a.title: Cerebral hypoperfusion
option_a.description: Reduced blood flow to the brain, leading to insufficient oxygen and nutrient delivery.

option_b.title: Cerebral activity dysfunction
option_b.description: Disruption of normal brain function, leading to impaired cognitive and motor activity.

option_c.title: Both cerebral hypoperfusion and activity dysfunction
option_c.description: A combination of both factors contributing to malaise.

option_d.title: Other medical conditions
option_d.description: Malaise can be caused by various underlying medical conditions, such as infections or autoimmune disorders.
